From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin persuādēre (“to persuade”), with normal change of conjugation to -ir.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central, Balearic) [pər.su.əˈði]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [peɾ.su.aˈðiɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)
  • Rhymes: -i(ɾ)

Verb

[edit]

persuadir (first-person singular present persuadeixo, first-person singular preterite persuadí, past participle persuadit)

  1. (transitive) to persuade
    Synonyms: conquistar, convèncer
    Antonym: dissuadir

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of persuadir (third conjugation, with -eix-)

Related terms

[edit]
  • persuasible
  • persuasió
  • persuasiu

Further reading

[edit]
  • “persuadir”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “persuadir”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “persuadir” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Ido

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /persuaˈdir/

Verb

[edit]

persuadir

  1. past infinitive of persuadar

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Learned borrowing from Latin persuādēre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /peʁ.su.aˈd͡ʒi(ʁ)/ [peh.sʊ.aˈd͡ʒi(h)], (faster pronunciation) /peʁ.swaˈd͡ʒi(ʁ)/ [peh.swaˈd͡ʒi(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /peʁ.su.aˈd͡ʒi(ʁ)/ [peh.sʊ.aˈd͡ʒi(h)], (faster pronunciation) /peʁ.swaˈd͡ʒi(ʁ)/ [peh.swaˈd͡ʒi(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /peɾ.su.aˈd͡ʒi(ɾ)/ [peɾ.sʊ.aˈd͡ʒi(ɾ)], (faster pronunciation) /peɾ.swaˈd͡ʒi(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /peʁ.su.aˈd͡ʒi(ʁ)/ [peχ.sʊ.aˈd͡ʒi(χ)], (faster pronunciation) /peʁ.swaˈd͡ʒi(ʁ)/ [peχ.swaˈd͡ʒi(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /peɻ.su.aˈd͡ʒi(ɻ)/ [peɻ.sʊ.aˈd͡ʒi(ɻ)], (faster pronunciation) /peɻ.swaˈd͡ʒi(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /pɨɾ.swaˈdiɾ/ [pɨɾ.swaˈðiɾ]
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /pɨɾ.swaˈdiɾ/ [pɨɾ.swaˈðiɾ]
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /pɨɾ.swaˈdi.ɾi/ [pɨɾ.swaˈði.ɾi]

  • Hyphenation: per‧su‧a‧dir

Verb

[edit]

persuadir (first-person singular present persuado, first-person singular preterite persuadi, past participle persuadido)

  1. (transitive) to persuade (convince through reasoning)
    Antonym: dissuadir

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of persuadir (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)

Derived terms

[edit]
  • despersuadir
  • persuadível

Related terms

[edit]
  • persuasível
  • persuasivo
  • persuasão

Further reading

[edit]
  • “persuadir”, in Dicionário Priberam da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Lisbon: Priberam, 2008–2025

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin persuādēre (“to persuade”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /peɾswaˈdiɾ/ [peɾ.swaˈð̞iɾ]
  • Rhymes: -iɾ
  • Syllabification: per‧sua‧dir

Verb

[edit]

persuadir (first-person singular present persuado, first-person singular preterite persuadí, past participle persuadido)

  1. (transitive) to persuade
    Antonym: disuadir

Conjugation

[edit]

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
